sentences: Michalis Hatzigiannis (Greek: Μιχάλης Χατζηγιάννης; born 5 November 1978) is a Greek Cypriot singer, musician, and record producer.
section: N/A

sentences: From 2000 to 2010, he received over 30 sales certifications in Greece, making him one of the most successful artists of the decade.
section: N/A

sentences: He is also known for representing Cyprus in the Eurovision Song Contest in 1998.

sentences: In March 2006 he released his first live album taken from the recorded concerts in Lycabettus with three new songs "De Fevgo" (I'm not leaving), "Den Eimai Edo Gia Kanena" (I'm not here for anyone) and "Miazoume" (We're alike), all becoming hits.
section: == Musical career == | === 2006–2008: Filoi Kai Ekthri and 7 ===

section: == Musical career == | === 2006–2008: Filoi Kai Ekthri and 7 ===

section: == Musical career == | === 2006–2008: Filoi Kai Ekthri and 7 ===

sentences: In December 2006 he released his fourth studio album, "Filoi Kai Ehthri" (Friends and foes) with some many hit singles, including "Na Eisai Ekei" (To be there), "Aisthimata" (Feelings), "Heria Psila" (Hands High).
section: == Musical career == | === 2006–2008: Filoi Kai Ekthri and 7 ===

sentences: On 15 December he began performing at Vox music hall in Athens.
section: == Musical career == | === 2006–2008: Filoi Kai Ekthri and 7 ===

sentences: He also embarked on another summer tour in Greece, after his appearances in Vox ending in May.

sentences: In October and November he toured internationally by staging concerts in Germany, Netherlands, Switzerland and Belgium.

sentences: He also commenced another winter season at Vox, this time alongside Glykeria.
section: == Musical career == | === 2006–2008: Filoi Kai Ekthri and 7 ===
